title: Meet the Silicon Valley millionaire techies turning their hand to winemaking
text:
Once a year, Valeta Rodgers, wife of TJ Rodgers - the self-made founder of microchip company Cypress Semiconductor - loses 10lb by juicing. Not the green kind discussed on Goop. Instead, she dons a wetsuit, special neoprene booties designed for abalone fishing, and stomps eight hours a day for a week, crushing grapes for the Rodgers' winery, Clos de la Tech.

Rodgers is now part of a select group of Silicon-Valley-tycoon vintners. Other notable California vineyard owners include Alain and Gérard Wertheimer (the reclusive brothers behind Chanel), who bought the St Supéry vineyard in Napa Valley in 2015; tech venture capitalist Kevin Harvey; and media kingpin Rupert Murdoch.
